page.title: 09St Peter's Church, Ash.
page.content: This church was mentioned in the first Domesday Book.The oldest parts of the present church are the south aisle, Lady chapel and the south door.This is a fine example of Norman stonework and makes a fitting entrance into a delightful church.In the 19th century the church was enlarged and it can now seat 300 people .The windows put in during rebuilding show stories from the bible.Two smaller lancet windows one in the south wall and one in the north wall are much older.There is an unusual wooden octogonal font and two mason jokes can be found on stone work of the chancel arch.
